thread.title: Area Roundup 10-13-15: Riverside Prep edges AAE to create tie atop AVC
thread.title_full: Area Roundup 10-13-15: Riverside Prep edges AAE to create tie atop AVC

author: Staff Reports
title: Area Roundup 10-13-15: Riverside Prep edges AAE to create tie atop AVC
text: Posted Oct. 13, 2015 at 12:01 AM Updated at 10:21 PM Posted Oct. 13, 2015 at 12:01 AM Updated at 10:21 PM » Social News HELENDALE — The Riverside Prep boys cross country team beat Academy for Academic Excellence by a point to create a tie atop the Agape Valley Conference standings. The Silver Knights beat the Knights 46-47. Riverside Prep came in fourth place last meet. Both teams have identical 17-3 records now. Apple Valley Christian’s Robert Saieg took first place with a time of 17 minutes, 24 seconds. Excelsior’s Matt Brower (17:24) and University Prep’s J.J. Pace (17:37) came in second and third, respectively. University Prep ran away with the girls meet, beating out second-place Riverside Prep 35-55. Riverside Prep’s Faith Soto (21:05) took first place followed by teammate Johanne Amaya (21:56) and Apple Valley Christian’s Annalee Losch (22:54) The next AVC meet will be held Oct. 20 at Horsemen’s Center Park. Agape Valley Conference Cluster Meet No. 4 At Helendale Boys Teams 1. Riverside Prep 46; 2. Academy for Academic Excellence 47; 3. University Prep 77; 4. Excelsior 88; 5. Apple Valley Christian 111; 6. Academy of Careers and Exploration 118. Individuals 1. Saieg (Apple Valley Christian) 17:24; 2.Brower (E) 17:32; 3. Pace (U) 17:37; 4. Ochoa (R) 17:42; 5. J. Bonato (AAE) 17:50; 6. C. Romero (AAE) 18:12; 7. Andicochea (R) 18:17; 8. D. Romero (AAE) 18:23; 9. Callicott (R) 18:38; 10. Martinez (U) 18:59. Standings 1. Riverside Prep 17-3; 2. AAE 17-3; 3. University Prep 12-8; 4. Excelsior 10-10; 5. Apple Valley Christian 4-16; 6. ACE 0-20. Girls 1. University Prep 35; 2. Riverside Prep 55; 3. ACE 64; 4. AAE 85. Individuals 1. Soto (R) 21:05; 2. Amaya (R) 21:56; 3. Losch (AVCS) 22:54; 4. Broedsgaard (U) 23:13; 5. Romero (ACE) 23:15; 6. Serrato (R) 23:56; 7. Garcia (U) 24:30; 8. Martinez (U) 24:37; 9. Alnakoud (AAE) 24:45; 10. Henderson (U) 24:59. Standings 1. University Prep 11-1; 2. Riverside Prep 9-3; 3. AAE 3-9; 4. ACE 1-11. PREP GIRLS TENNIS Barstow 15, Victor Valley 3 At Barstow, the Aztecs’ top doubles team of Lucky Jordan and Karli Godfrey put up a triple bagel as the Aztecs beat Victor Valley 15-3 on Tuesday afternoon. No. 2 singles player Alex Yost swept 6-0, 6-1, 7-5 for the Aztecs. Victor Valley’s May Aye won two of her team’s three sets. She went 6-3, 6-2, 5-7. The win helps Barstow (6-2 DSL) set up two pivotal matches against Silverado in the next week. The Aztecs currently are in second place with Silverado trailing in third. The Aztecs travel to play Silverado on Wednesday to play a match that was rained out earlier in the season. They return to Silverado on Oct. 20 to play the Hawks again. In between, Barstow heads to the a tournament in Antelope Valley on Friday and Saturday. Victor Valley Singles Aye 6-3, 6-2, 5-7; Shirley 0-6, 1-6, 3-6; Rivera 1-6, 1-6, 0-6. Victor Valley Doubles Esperanza-Gomez 0-6, 3-6, 6-1; M. Flores-Y. Flores 2-6, 1-6; Malgarejo-Guido 0-6; Carranza-Herrera 1-6, 0-6, 0-6. Barstow Singles O’Neal 3-6, 6-3, 6-0; Yost 6-0, 6-1, 7-5; Jancilan 6-1, 2-6; Baldovinos 6-1. Barstow Doubles Jordan-Godfrey 6-0, 6-0, 6-0; Halsey-Bercerra 6-2, 6-0, 6-3; Crane-Paladini 6-1, 6-1; Fields-Iszbella Santini 1-6. Serrano 16, Apple Valley 2 At Phelan, the D’backs No. 3 singles player Jessie Kim swept 6-2, 6-1, 7-5 against the Sun Devils. The No. 3 doubles team of Lauren Evans and Tiffany Tran also swept, winning 6-1, 6-0, 6-3. Serrano fell from No. 3 to No. 4 in this week’s CIF-Southern Section Division 4 poll. Serrano (17-0, 11-0 Mojave River League) travels to play Sultana on Thursday. Apple Valley Singles Corey 2-6, 1-6, 5-7; Hathaway 0-6, 0-6, 1-6; Romero 0-6, 2-6, 7-5. Apple Valley Doubles ]Webb-Conrad 0-6, 0-6, 3-6; Sanchez-Fernandez 0-6, 0-6; Sanchez-Acosta 5-7; Aguilar-Stine 0-6, 7-6 (3), 1-6. Serrano Singles Cortez 6-2, 6-0, 6-0; Ellis 6-1, 6-0; Everly 5-7; Kim 6-2, 6-1, 7-5. Serrano Doubles Slocumb-Ellis 6-0, 6-0; Olson-Serna 7-5; Tarver-Windward 6-0, 6-0; Gonzalez-Ford 6-7 (3); Evans-Tran 6-1, 6-0, 6-3. Burroughs 15, Hesperia 3 At Hesperia, the Burros beat the Scorpions on the road. Hesperia (1-10 MRL) travels to play Apple Valley on Thursday. Burroughs Singles M. Kolar 6-3, 6-2, 6-0; E. Aralar 6-0, 6-0, 6-0; K. Koch 2-6, 6-0, 6-3. Burroughs Doubles E. Mower-McGrew 6-0, 6-1, 6-2; A. Cook-S. Osterman 6-7 (1), 6-1, 6-1; J. Francis-M. Camacho 4-6; H. Weik-S. Hudson 7-5; J. Weik-T. Palmer 6-4. Hesperia Singles M. Smith 3-6, 0-6, 6-2; C. Smith 2-6, 0-6, 0-6; Ruvacalba 0-6, 0-6, 3-6. Hesperia Doubles K. Connolly-F. Aguilar 0-6, 7-6 (1), 4-6; V. Sanchez-H. Chum 1-6, 1-6, 5-7; M. Garcia-D. Medina 1-6, 6-4; Espinoza-A. Aguilara 2-6. Granite Hills 18, Adelanto 0 At Adelanto, the Cougars swept the Saints. Audrey Stewart, Nicole Pluta and Monika Mehta all triple bageled for the Cougars. Granite Hills (9-0) plays at Barstow on Oct. 22. Granite Hills Singles Stewart 6-0, 6-0, 6-0; Pluta 6-0, 6-0, 6-0; Mehta 6-0, 6-0, 6-0 Granite Hills Doubles O’Kelly-Garcia 6-1, 6-0, 6-1; Torres-Koppel 6-0, 6-1, 6-0; Andrade-Cocke 7-5, 6-0; Cocke-Donado 6-1 Adelanto Singles Macias 0-6, 0-6, 0-6; Lopez 0-6, 0-6, 0-6; Ceja Gabriel 0-6, 0-6, 0-6 Adelanto Doubles Saloman-Bobadilla 1-6, 0-6, 1-6; Leon-Mercado 0-6, 1-6, 5-7; Salguero-Salgado 1-6, 0-6, 0-6 Oak Hills 13, Sultana 5 At Oak Hills, the Bulldogs picked up a Mojave River League win. Karina Heredia swept for the Bulldogs 6-1, 6-3, 6-2. Oak Hills (10-4, 7-4 MRL) plays at Burroughs on Thursday. Sultana Singles Vargas 2-6, 3-6, 6-2; A. Johnson 3-6, 2-6, 6-2; L. Johnson 6-3, 3-6, 7-6 (2) Sultana Doubles Williams-McDonald 3-6, 6-7 (4), 2-6; Baker-Williams 1-6, 1-6, 3-6; Farias-Gomez 2-6, 0-6, 6-3 Oak Hills Singles K. Heredia 6-1, 6-3, 6-2; Paige 6-3, 6-3; Moreno 6-7 (2); McMahon 3-6, 2-6; Gonzalez 2-6 Oak Hills Doubles Smith-Torres, 6-3, 6-0, 6-3; Evans-B. Heredia 6-1, 7-6 (4), 3-6; Akoh-Brar 6-2, 6-1, 6-2 PREP GIRLS VOLLEYBALL Granite Hills 3, Barstow 0 At Barstow, Alicia Christensen knocked down 11 kills as the Cougars remained unbeaten in Desert Sky League play. Granite Hills swept 25-22, 25-19, 25-15. Lea Wiggington scored seven kills, 10 digs and two aces; Lauren Wilson contributed six kills and six digs; and Kacy Hele added two aces and 24 assists. Granite Hills (7-0 DSL) travels to play Silverado on Thursday. Silverado 3, Victor Valley 0 At Victorville, the Hawks topped the Jackrabbits in three sets — 25-22, 25-13, 25-21. Kamara Haile led Victor Valley with six kills, six digs and four blocks; Emily Vadillo chipped in with 11 digs and two kills; Kristen De La Torre added 14 digs; Demara Haile had nine digs; and Mady Chavez had an 18-assist night. Victor Valley (4-4 DSL) travels to play Barstow on Tuesday. Hesperia Christian 3, Apple Valley Christian 0 At Hesperia, the Patriots remained unbeaten atop the Agape League with a 25-12, 25-11, 25-9 sweep at home. Mia Williams knocked down 10 kills and added 11 digs; Brooke Johnson contributed eight assists, four aces and scored 19 point; and Kayli Klasa added nine assists, seven aces and eight digs. Apple Valley Christian’s Shaylie McCloud had three kills and two blocks and Marissa Covarubias added nine digs and two kills. Hesperia Christian (8-3, 4-0 Agape League) travels to play Lucerne Valley on Thursday. Apple Valley Christian (2-9, 2-2 Agape League) Victor Valley Christian at home on Thursday. University Prep 3, ACE 1 At Helendale, Sandhya Rajkumar led the Jaguars with 10 kills as they beat the Eagles in four games — 25-7, 23-25, 25-14, 25-15 Daija Padilla chipped in with eight aces and 15 digs and Justice Borden added seven aces and nine digs. Julie Molina led Academy of Careers and Exploration with two aces, two kills, three blocks and four digs; Anna Menough chimed in with two kills and three digs; Makayla Simmons one ace, three kills Gaby Gonzalez one kill, two assists and three digs. University Prep (13-3-1, 7-1 CVL) is at Cobalt Institute of Math and Science on Thursday for a nonleague game. ACE (0-7 CVL) is at Excelsior on Thursday. Bethel Christian 3, Victor Valley Christian 1 At Victorville, the Royals played a tight match with the Eagles but ultimately lost 25-19, 25-27, 28-30, 14-25 Victor Valley Christian’s Kayla Jeffress had five kills, 22 assists, two aces and 10 digs; Cydney Fitzer chipped in with five kills, 10 aces and 21 digs; and Olivia Dimmick added seven kills, three assists and 18 digs. VVCS (1-5, 1-3 Agape League) travels to play Apple Valley Christian on Thursday. Riverside Prep 3, Excelsior 0 At Oro Grande, the Silver Knights kept their playoff hopes alive with a sweep of Excelsior. Riverside Prep won 25-6, 25-15, 25-14 in a comfortable win over the Eagles. Tatiana Barajas had three aces and 11 digs for the Silver Knights; Stephanie McDowell posted three aces, four assists and four digs; Breanna Pedrin notched seven kills and six digs; and Kendall Clark-Davis contributed five kills and seven digs “This was a big improvement for us, last week we had 27 errors against ACE and won in five and we had 30 against Immanuel Christian and lost in five,” Riverside Prep coach Casey Kemble sand. “We only had nine errors today, so that’s a big improvement.” Riverside Prep (8-7-2, 3-4 CVL) plays at AAE on Thursday. PREP BOYS WATER POLO Granite Hills 13, Summit 4 At Fontana, the Cougars picked up a blowout San Andrea League win. Connor Garcia and Anthony Nassar scored two goals apiece, while Josh Burfield chipped in a pair of goals. Granite Hills (10-4, 5-2 DSL) hosts Arroyo Valley at 4:30 p.m. on Oct. 20. Granite Hills 5 5 2 1 — 13 Summit 0 0 1 4 — 5 Granite Hills (13) Garcia 3, Nassar 3, Burfield 2, Cooper 1, Gomez 1, Tomlin 1, Ashworth 1, Wishaw 1; Saves — Hetherly 3 Summit (5) Sparks 2, Cairo 2, George 1; Saves — Savala 3, Latin 1 By Staff Reports
